page.title: 03Spaxton V.C.Primary School.
page.content: Henry Labouchere,who was created Baron of Taunton in 1859 built Spaxton School in 1860.He dedicated the school to his eldest daughter,the Hon.Mary Dorothy Stanley,who was a governor for many years. The original school consisted of a large room,divided into two classrooms,with a small infant class.This building remains with its original high windows. In the early 1960,s a Pratten hut was added housing the kitchen classroom and office.In 1970 a learner swimming pool was built by parents. An Elliot temporary classroom came in 1978.There are 2 classes in the school.Infants 18,Juniors 18.Head plus one teacher,and 2/10ths Head relief.Most children arrive by car.A mini_bus for those over 3 miles away.Meals are cooked at school for us
